Title: dpkg: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability was discovered in dpkg which could potentially lead
    to arbitrary code execution.

Description.Text: Gentoo Linux developer, Hanno BÃ¶ck, discovered an off-by-one error in the dpkg-deb component of dpkg, the Debian package management system, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow.

Impact.Text: An attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code if an user or an automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted Debian binary package (.deb).

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All dpkg users should upgrade to the latest version:
